Summary: large, starlike object hovered briefly, then shrank to a small dot
divs: sighting detailsi stepped out of my front door (which faces south) at around 3:45am saturday august 11, 2012 to have a cigarette. i immediately saw a very large, starlike object to the east just hovering. at first i thought it was venus but quickly realized it was way too large and bright--my thumb at arms length didn't block it from my sight and it was about twice as bright as i have ever seen venus. i stepped down off of my steps and realized that the moon, which was at waning gibbous and still quite bright, was only a short distance from the moon. i held out my hand at arms length and it was about the distance from my thumb to little finger tip with my fingers spread as far as i could. if it was that bright that close to the moon then i think it may have been bright enough to see in the daytime. as i watched, it suddenly shrank it size\brightness until it was a small dot, about as bright as one of the dimmer stars in the sky (a little dipper star maybe). i could barely believe my own eyes. then a small cloud moved in front of the object and when the cloud moved on the object was gone. i watched for a little while longer but it didn't come back.
